messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Animals - Goats
messages.msgSnippet: Just a hint on the goats.  Once they have been in the house they think they are people and should live their permanently!  One of our does use to knock at the
messages.messageBody:
Just a hint on the goats. Once they have been in the house they think they
are people and should live their permanently! One of our does use to knock
at the door to be let in (she'd jump the fence and come calling). She had
been bottle raised in the house.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "Russ Anderson" <anderclan@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 02, 2001 2:53 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Animals - Goats


> ahhh... we move to our mini-farm in exactly 15 more days.. the girls and I
> go to pick out our 3 baby goats tomorrow morning! And we have another
friend
> giving us a Donkey! Instant farm .. can hardly wait. Now if I can find a
> couple of sheep and a horse...ha..
> Julie in MO - who also loves the smell of manure
>
> >Needless to say we now have a week old baby goat living in the
> >house....unsanitary...yeah...learning experience definitely!!!
> >
>

messages.subject: Re: Animals - Goats
messages.msgSnippet: ahhh... we move to our mini-farm in exactly 15 more days.. the girls and I go to pick out our 3 baby goats tomorrow morning! And we have another friend giving
messages.messageBody:
ahhh... we move to our mini-farm in exactly 15 more days.. the girls and I
go to pick out our 3 baby goats tomorrow morning! And we have another friend
giving us a Donkey! Instant farm .. can hardly wait. Now if I can find a
couple of sheep and a horse...ha..
Julie in MO - who also loves the smell of manure

>Needless to say we now have a week old baby goat living in the
>house....unsanitary...yeah...learning experience definitely!!!
>
